title: looking for 1962 Ford Detroit Tiger postcards
author: jimtigers65

posts.post_title: looking for 1962 Ford Detroit Tiger postcards
posts.post_content:
Updated 8 December 2024. Looking to purchase 1962 Ford Detroit Tiger postcards. I need the following:
Dick Brown
Phil Cavaretta
Jack Homel
Mike Roarke

I wrote Terry Fox asking him when these were taken? He said a Ford representative grabbed a bunch of players and posed them along side a Ford automobile during Lakeland FL spring training. Mr. Fox even sent me a signed postcard of himself.

I alway's wondered with Al Kaline and Norm Cash were not included in this set.

Thanks for looking
Jim

U should be able to find half of those with due diligence 
The other half ive been looking for , for 15 years
And have only seen 1 of each in a personal collection that were all unsigned

posts.post_title: What r the toughest in order if I may ask?
posts.post_content: Thx u in advance.
I conduct a daily search of these postcards on ebay. The only ones that I see are Osbourne and Boros.
I have a signed Ron Nischwitz. Any idea of the value?

Bump. Here is my collection so far...

[url]http://[URL=http://s1065.photobucket.com/user/jholman12002/media/baseball%20004_zpszkoxyhnd.jpg.html][IMG]http://i1065.photobucket.com/albums/u383/jholman12002/baseball%20004_zpszkoxyhnd.jpg[/IMG][/url][/URL]
Still looking for these.

Why are the only ones advertised on ebay are Steve Boros and Larry Osbourne? I'm toying with the idea to see how many different autograph Osbournes I could get signed to various people. Heck, I have one made out to Jim and Dave.
Picked up another Larry Osbourne autograph postcard. This was was made out to Chris.
afew u need on ebay

[quote name="sflayank" post=1620923]afew u need on ebay[/QUOTE]

Larry,

 I saw them the other day when I was doing my daily search. What do you think of the opening bids?
Opening bids are most likely influenced from your want list above.  Sellers will try to get top dollar known as "market price" when they know one person has to have it.

They are high
The myatt is the toughest of those
Should go for 100-150

Jim:   
I don't see Colavito on your want list nor in your "have" post. ???

Sealmark

[quote name="sealmark" post=1621834]Jim:   
I don't see Colavito on your want list nor in your "have" post. ???

Sealmark[/QUOTE]

Yea, I missed typing it in. It is on my wantlist.

For 20 -25 years I have been looking for Brown, Homel and Roarke, Willing to pay to dollar to complete my set.  Any help out there?

Sealmark

Dick brown just sold for 372
Ridiculous price but rare
So whos to say

This is my 5 year bump. Still looking for 1961 Ford Detroit Postcards. I need the following:
Hank Aguirre 
Dick Brown
Jim Bunning
Phil Cavarretta 
Jack Homel
Ron Kline
Mike Roarke
Tough cards.

My yearly bump, still need the following:
Aguirre 
Brown
Bunning
Cavarretta 
Homel
Kline 
Roarke

A few years ago I wrote to Terry Fox asking him about this set. He said Ford grabbed a bunch of Tigers and took the to a local golf course for a photo shoot. He even sent a postcard of himself from this set.

I was able to pick up a Aguirre, Bunning, and Kline. Down to needing four:
 Dick Brown
Phil Cavarretta
Jack Homel
Mike Roarke
I made progress this year as I was able to pick up a Jim Bunning and Ron Kline.
Jim:  Great tough set to complete . Were all or only some of them signed ?

[quote name="insidethewrapper" post=2444500]Jim:  Great tough set to complete . Were all or only some of them signed ?[/QUOTE]

I have signed postcards by Aguirre, Bunning, Colavito, Fox, Goldy, Kline, Mossi, Myatt, Nischwitz, and Osborne.
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=626547&d=1719697473[/IMG]

Bought a collection recently with dozens of old Tigers postcards (and most other teams). I was certain there were a few of these in there. Alas, I only found Fox, Mossi (x2), and Osborne. All signed, but not the ones you're looking for. I only got half of this collection, though. I'll check with my friend who has the other half. Hopefully we can help get you closer.

[quote name="captainfitz" post=2455957]Bought a collection recently with dozens of old Tigers postcards (and most other teams). I was certain there were a few of these in there. Alas, I only found Fox, Mossi (x2), and Osborne. All signed, but not the ones you're looking for. I only got half of this collection, though. I'll check with my friend who has the other half. Hopefully we can help get you closer.[/QUOTE]

I would be interested in seeing what other Tiger postcards you picked up. In addition to the Ford set, Dodge Motor Company released postcards of Mickey Lolich and Bill Freehan. Also, Lincoln Mercury released a few featuring Al Kaline.

[quote name="jimtigers65" post=2456250]I would be interested in seeing what other Tiger postcards you picked up. In addition to the Ford set, Dodge Motor Company released postcards of Mickey Lolich and Bill Freehan. Also, Lincoln Mercury released a few featuring Al Kaline.[/QUOTE]
Looks like a lot of team issued photo cards and JD McCarthy produced postcards. I'll try to grab you some pics a little later. Unfortunately, I don't see any other car-related ones like you mentioned.

I was able to pickup a Ron Kline this summer. I’m down to needing four more:
Dick Brown
Phil Cavarretta 
Jack Homel 
Mike Roarke


I had a bid on a Roarke on eBay a couple years ago but lost in the final minutes. I haven’t seen  the other three postcards.
I was excited that I received a private message regarding these postcards. However, I got the scammer saying “My old man ave this available in good condition.” Ugh…still looking😀
